title: Sargan–Hansen test
summary: The Sargan–Hansen test or Sargan's J {\displaystyle J} test is a statistical test used for testing over-identifying restrictions in a statistical model. It was proposed by John Denis Sargan in 1958,[1] and several variants were derived by him in 1975.[2] Lars Peter Hansen re-worked through the derivations and showed that it can be extended to general non-linear GMM in a time series context.[3]
